files.description: Single-command validation harness that runs the scaffold generator, verifies required artifacts in outputs/, and writes a pass/fail QA report under outputs/qa/.
Core validation logic for locating project root, invoking the generator deterministically, checking expected files (including rights artifacts), and producing structured results.
Utilities to render validation results as a human-readable report and machine-readable JSON saved to outputs/qa/.
Path and filesystem helpers to resolve outputs directories, enforce deterministic locations, and support cross-platform execution.
Subprocess runner wrapper to execute the scaffold generator command with controlled environment, timeouts, and captured stdout/stderr.
Declarative list of required output artifacts and matching rules (exact filenames plus rights-artifact patterns) used by the validation harness.
Documentation for running the single-command validation harness, expected outputs, and interpreting the pass/fail reports under outputs/qa/.
Project configuration defining the minimal Python package layout and an entry-point script for the validation harness.

missionDescription: Create a minimal automated validation harness (e.g., a single command/script) that runs the scaffold generator and then verifies expected files exist in /outputs (REPORT_OUTLINE.md, CASE_STUDY_TEMPLATE.md, METADATA_SCHEMA.md, CASE_STUDIES_INDEX.csv, rights artifacts) and outputs a pass/fail report saved under /outputs/qa/.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Even after execution, the system needs a repeatable check to prevent regressions. Current state has code but no validation artifacts; a lightweight harness converts ad-hoc runs into a reliable pipeline step.
projectName: minimal automated validation harness (e.g., a single command/script) that runs the scaffold generator and then verifies expected files exist in /outputs (REPORT_OUTLINE.md, CASE_STUDY_TEMPLATE.md, METADATA_SCHEMA.md, CASE_STUDIES_INDEX.csv, rights artifacts) and outputs a pass/fail report saved under /outputs/qa/.
